trans-unit.source: Represents a trigger that applies property values or performs actions when the bound data meet a set of conditions.

A <xref:System.Windows.MultiDataTrigger> object is similar to a <xref:System.Windows.MultiTrigger>, except that the conditions of a <xref:System.Windows.MultiDataTrigger> are based on property values of bound data instead of those of a <xref:System.Windows.UIElement>.
In a <xref:System.Windows.MultiDataTrigger>, a condition is met when the property value of the data item matches the specified <xref:System.Windows.Condition.Value%2A>.

You can then use setters or the <xref:System.Windows.TriggerBase.EnterActions%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.TriggerBase.ExitActions%2A> properties to apply changes or start actions when all of the conditions are met.
The <xref:System.Windows.MultiDataTrigger.Setters%2A> property of a <xref:System.Windows.MultiDataTrigger> object can only consist of <xref:System.Windows.Setter> objects.

Adding a <xref:System.Windows.Setter> child to a <xref:System.Windows.MultiDataTrigger> object implicitly adds it to the <xref:System.Windows.SetterBaseCollection> for the <xref:System.Windows.MultiDataTrigger> object.
<xref:System.Windows.EventSetter> objects are not supported; only <xref:System.Windows.Style.Setters%2A?displayProperty=fullName> supports <xref:System.Windows.EventSetter> objects.
For information about when to use triggers and when to use other techniques, see [Data Templating Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/data/data-templating-overview.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.MultiDataTrigger"></xref> class.
Gets a collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Condition"></xref> objects.
Changes to property values are applied when all the conditions in the collection are met.

A <xref:System.Windows.MultiDataTrigger> object is similar to a <xref:System.Windows.MultiTrigger>, except that the conditions of a <xref:System.Windows.MultiDataTrigger> are based on property values of bound data instead of those of a <xref:System.Windows.UIElement>.
In a <xref:System.Windows.MultiDataTrigger>, a condition is met when the property value of the data item matches the specified <xref:System.Windows.Condition.Value%2A>.
That value is first converted to the type of the value of the binding, if possible, and then the two values are compared using the `Object.Equals` method.
The <xref:System.Windows.MultiTrigger> applies the associated setters or actions when all of the conditions are true (binary `AND` operation).
For a <xref:System.Windows.MultiDataTrigger>, each condition in the collection must set both the <xref:System.Windows.Condition.Binding%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Condition.Value%2A> properties.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Condition.Binding%2A>.
XAML Property Element Usage
XAML Values
*zeroOrMoreConditions*
Zero or more <xref:System.Windows.Condition> objects.
A collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Condition"></xref> objects.
The default is an empty collection.

Gets a collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Setter"></xref> objects that describe the property values to apply when all the conditions of the <xref href="System.Windows.MultiDataTrigger"></xref> are met.

<xref:System.Windows.MultiDataTrigger> enables you to start actions by using the <xref:System.Windows.TriggerBase.EnterActions%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.TriggerBase.ExitActions%2A> properties, or to set property values by using <xref:System.Windows.Setter> objects when the bound data meet a set of conditions.
If there are two <xref:System.Windows.Setter> objects in the same or different setter collections setting the same property, the <xref:System.Windows.Setter> that is declared last is used.

Adding a <xref:System.Windows.Setter> child to a <xref:System.Windows.MultiDataTrigger> object implicitly adds it to the <xref:System.Windows.SetterBaseCollection> for the <xref:System.Windows.MultiDataTrigger> object.
<xref:System.Windows.EventSetter> objects are not supported; only <xref:System.Windows.Style.Setters%2A?displayProperty=fullName> supports <xref:System.Windows.EventSetter> objects.
XAML Property Element Usage
XAML Values
*zeroOrMoreSetters*
Zero or more <xref:System.Windows.Setter> objects.
A collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Setter"></xref> objects.
The default value is an empty collection.
Adds a child object.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.MultiDataTrigger> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Markup.IAddChild> interface.
The child object to add.
Adds the text content of a node to the object.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.MultiDataTrigger> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Markup.IAddChild> interface.
The text to add to the object.
